description.en: In the firs semester, seminars introduce theories widely used in the study of languages and cultures and their possible range of applications. In the second semester, seminars are dedicated to the discussion of the students' MA thesis ideas and the possible theoretical and methodological approaches to the thesis. Students make presentations on the different stages of their developing theses, provide feedback to each other and engage in an interdisciplinary discussion with their peers.
description.et: Esimesel semestril tutvutakse keelte ja kultuuride uurimises laialt kasutatavate teooriatega ning nende erinevate rakendusvõimalustega. Teisel semestril arutatakse erinevate erialade magistrantide kujunevaid magistritöö ideid ning tööde võimalikku teoreetilist ja metoodilist raamistikku. Üliõpilased tutvustavad oma areneva töö etappe ja kommenteerivad üksteise töid.

objectives.en: The aim of the seminar is to help the students of the different specialities of the European languages and cultures MA curriculum to develop their understanding of theories relevant for the study of European languages and cultures, to develop their MA thesis, provide many-sided feedback to the developing work and to develop the students' presentation and communication skills in English.
objectives.et: Seminari eesmärk on aidata Euroopa keelte ja kultuuride õppekava erinevate erialade magistrantidel arendada oma teadmisi võõrkeelte ja kultuuride uurimises vajalikest teooriatest, arendada magistritöö ideid, pakkuda sellele mitmekülgset tagasisidet ning arendada üliõpilaste võõrkeelse suhtluse oskust.

learning_outcomes.en: Students develop theoretical knowledge and skills necessary for conducting research in the area of foreign languages and cultures as well as the skill of academic presentation and communication in English and the foreign language of their speciality.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane omandab võõrkeelse uurimistöö läbiviimiseks vajalikke teoreetilisi teadmisi ja uurimisvõtteid ning arendab võõrkeelse akadeemilise suhtluse oskust oma erialale vastavas võõrkeeles ja inglise keeles.

independent_work.et: Independent work on the MA thesis with one's supervisor.

description.et: Attendance and active participation in seminar sessions. Students are expected to attend all sessions, read the assigned texts and to actively participate in the discussion. All students will talk about their own research in the final seminars of the semester. Active participation forms 50% of the grade.

At the end of the semester, students prepare a paper in which they apply one of the theories discussed during the semester in the analysis of some topic that is related to their MA thesis or other interests. The paper forms 50% of the final grade.

grade_preconditions.et: Active participation in the seminars and reading of the required materials.

grade_evaluation.et:
Active participation in seminars 50%
Written application of one of the theories introduced 50%

debt_elimination.et: In accordance with the Study Regulations.
